sounds.lets: Let's take a look at my resume.

resume.title: Resume
resume.paragraph: My technical skills encompasses lots of technologies and tools like Angular, RxJS, NgRx, NgRx effects, React.js, Redux, Vue.js, Vuex, Nuxt, JavaScript (ES5, ES6), TypeScript, Sass, HTML5, CSS3, ElectronJS, Node.js, Ajax, Git, Jest, Jasmine and others.

education.title: Education
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (B.Sc. CS)

discover.role: SAP Commerce CX | Composable Storefront (Spartacus) Developer

responsibilities.development: Development and maintenance of SAP Commerce Composable storefront (aka Spartacus) applications.
responsibilities.communication: Communication with the design and product teams in order to properly deliver something that can actually attend the client's needs.
responsibilities.collaboration: Collaboration with the design team in order to provide the FED POV and help in the shaping of a great solution from all the perspectives.
responsibilities.assist: Assist abroad teams on their SAP Composable Storefront solutions, helping them solve specific issues so they could be unblocked (communication in English).

responsibilities.implementation: Implementation of the first SAP Spartacus & Telco Utilities application of the world, for a big client from the Telecom segment. Techs: Angular, TypeScript, RxJS, NgRx, SAP Spartacus.
responsibilities.communication: Communication with the design and product teams in order to provide meaningful and scalable FE solutions.
responsibilities.creation: Creation of reusable and responsive FE components.
responsibilities.delivery: Delivery of high quality and easy to maintain code.
responsibilities.testing: Unit testing with Jasmine and Karma, with a minimum code coverage of 80%.
responsibilities.guide: Help and guide less experienced developers.
responsibilities.studyProgram: Creation of an Angular internal study program to help other developers improve their skills.
responsibilities.presentations: Creation of multiple presentations about tech tendencies, best practices, code tooling, Angular, and SAP Spartacus.

responsibilities.architect: Architect, implement and maintain web applications for a big client from the Telecom segment using the Vue.js stack (Nuxt, VueX).
responsibilities.communication: Communication with the design and product teams in order to provide meaningful and scalable FE solutions.
responsibilities.creation: Creation of reusable and responsive FE components.
responsibilities.delivery: Delivery of high quality and easy to maintain code.
responsibilities.testing: Unit testing with Jest, with a minimum code coverage of 80%.
responsibilities.guide: Help and guide less experienced developers.

responsibilities.development: Development of an animation software focused on the creation of digital campaigns, using Vue.js, VueX and Electron.js.
responsibilities.full-stack: Full-stack developer responsible for the development of a sales web application, meant to sell and manage licenses of the mentioned animation software. Techs: React.js, Node.js, AdonisJS, redux, styled-components, Docker.
responsibilities.landing: Development of landing pages for various clients, using HTML5, CSS3 and Vanilla JavaScript.
responsibilities.communication: Communication with the design team in order to properly attend the UI/UX requirements.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Some interesting projects that I have worked on.

carhartt.title: Carhartt Company Gear
carhartt.description: E-commerce created for Carhartt, a U.S. heritage workwear brand. Carhartt's B2B branch is called CCG (Carhartt Company Gear), and I've been involved in the creation from the ground up of their new generation of CCG. There I was responsible for defining the project architecture, enforcing a coding style, doing code reviews, guiding and helping other developers and coding like there was no tomorrow!
carhartt.techs: SAP Spartacus, Angular, CDC (formerly Gygia), RxJs and TypeScript

vivo.title: Vivo Store
vivo.description: E-commerce created for Vivo (Telefonica), the biggest telecom company of Brazil. The e-commerce has been developed using the (at the moment) new SAP Spartacus technology, which is a modern way of building SAP commerces.
vivo.techs: SAP Spartacus, Angular, RxJs, NgRx and TypeScript

ml.title: Mercado Livre Copy — SAP Spartacus
ml.description: Personal project created to improve my SAP Composable Storefront (Spartacus) abilities. This project is a copy of the "Mercado Libre" E-commerce ("Mercado Livre" in Brazil), made with SAP Spartacus/Angular. To dedicate myself to client projects, I've never finished it, but who knows I do that someday.
ml.techs: SAP Spartacus, Angular, RxJs, NgRx and TypeScript

teams.title: Microsoft Teams Copy
teams.description: Personal project created when I was learning Angular. Nothing better than a project to teach us things that goes beyond the docs, right? My first project made with Angular was nothing but a Microsoft Teams copy, completely interactive. You could send messages, react to messages, and other cool stuff  messaging apps usually allows us to do.

finances.title: Monopoly Banker
finances.description: Personal project created during one of my job vacations. At some point I saw myself playing Monopoly with my niece and noticed how those physical bills were annoying, and that's the story behind the app. Monopoly Banker is an app for making money transfers between the players in real time, relying on the power of React, NodeJS, Mongo and Websockets. If you're interested about knowing more about it, there's a publication on my LinkedIn profile.
finances.techs: React, Node.js, Docker, MongoDB and Websockets

elderly.title: Aprenda Elderly — Learning plataform
elderly.description: Created to be presented as my Capstone Project, Aprenda Elderly is a learning platform focused on older adults that want to learn more about modern devices like computers and smartphones.
